Home

Events
>
Virtual Events
Virtual Events
Juneteenth Artist Talk with Jamie Robertson
Join us at The Frank for a virtual talk with artist Jamie Robertson. Jamie Robertson is a visual artist and educator who works in photography and video. Born and raised in Houston, her Texas roots inform her practice as she investigates the landscape of the American South as a living archive of Black life. Beginning with her own family, Robertson’s work physically and spiritually engages the land as a primary witness to Black resistance, solace, and power.
of
Transcript
Frank Contemporaries: November 2020
This virtual pop-up exhibition highlights the work of artists from the Nova Southeastern University community. Featured artists: Gabriel Aikens; Aswini Sivaram; Aliyah Bendas; Annabel Brewster, and Madison Mello.
of
Transcript
Virtual Dance Performance: "Color Space"
The Frank reflects on its 2018 exhibition "Perceptual Tracking: A Color Space" through a meditative installation activation by performance artists Jenny Larsson and the Wild Beast Collective.
of
Transcript
Artist Talk + Tour by Yochi Yakir Avin
Take a virtual walk-through of 'In Between,' a retrospective of works created by Yochi Yakir-Avin between 2015-2020. This Third Space Gallery exhibition reflects Yakir-Avin’s command of figuration and abstraction.
of
Transcript
Frank Contemporaries: December 2020
This virtual pop-up exhibition highlights the work of artists from the Miramar Cultural Center. Guest speaker: Camasha Cevieux. Featured artists: Miguel Marcel Russell, Jade Dyamond and Sandra Schlesinger.
of
Transcript

Home
>
About
About
The Frank C. Ortis Art Gallery
A Catalyst for Contemporary Art, Experimentation & Engagement
Named in honor of longtime Pembroke Pines Mayor Frank C. Ortis for his dedication to the arts, The Frank is a dynamic contemporary art space committed to fostering innovation, critical dialogue, and creative exploration. As a site for artistic research and interdisciplinary collaboration, The Frank champions groundbreaking exhibitions, experimental practices, and immersive programming that connect artists, thinkers, and communities in meaningful ways.
With an evolving roster of regional and national artists, The Frank’s exhibitions push boundaries across disciplines—ranging from visual arts and design to performance, new media, and socially engaged practices. Our expansive, two-story venue houses multiple exhibition spaces, including The Project Room and the  Third Space, alongside a dedicated learning studio designed for workshops, lectures, and hands-on engagement.
At The Frank, we believe in the power of art to inspire, challenge, and transform. Our free, inclusive programs welcome audiences of all ages, offering interactive experiences that nurture curiosity, critical thinking, and cultural exchange. Situated within the Charles F. Dodge City Center in Pembroke Pines, The Frank is more than a gallery—it’s a hub for artistic risk-taking, storytelling, and collective exploration in the contemporary art landscape.
Join us in shaping the future of art.
The Frank C. Ortis Art Gallery
601 City Center Way, Pembroke Pines, FL 33025
(954) 392-9420
TheFrank@ppines.com
Instagram: @thefrankpembrokepines
Facebook: The Frank Pembroke Pines
